question: If Tom has 5/12 of a cookie and Maya has 3/12 of a cookie, who has more cookies?
If Grandma has 3/8 of a bag of flour and Maya has 2/8 of a bag, whose bag has more flour?
Maya and Tom were baking cookies. If Maya used 1/2 cup of sugar for the recipe, how many cups of sugar did Tom use if he used an equivalent fraction?
In the garden, Maya watered 1/2 of the plants. If Tom watered an equivalent fraction of plants, how many plants did he water?

Maya and Tom were sorting through Grandma's fruit basket. They found that 1/7 of the fruit were apples, 4/7 of the oranges, and 5/7 of the bananas. Arrange the fruits in descending order based on the portion that is ripe.
Grandma had a basket of apples. If Maya ate 1/4 of the apples, how many apples did Tom eat if he ate an equivalent fraction?
Grandma showed Tom and Maya two rectangular-shaped plots, whose areas were shaded differently. Find out which plot has more shaded area.
Tom asked Grandma if she could tell him, which of the following fractions are like fractions?
If Maya has 17/18 of a chocolate bar and Tom has 21/18 of a chocolate bar, who has more chocolate?
options: Both have the same amount of chocolate

question: Maya and Tom are painting garden plots. Plot A has 2/5 of its area shaded, Plot B has 3/5, and Plot C has 4/5. Arrange the plots in ascending order based on the shaded area.
options: Plot A, Plot B, Plot C
Plot C, Plot B, Plot A
Plot B, Plot A, Plot C
Plot A, Plot C, Plot B

question: Maya and Tom are painting two rectangular garden plots for their grandma. The plot i has 9/5 of its area shaded, and the plot ii has 9/10 of its area shaded. Which garden plot has a larger shaded area, and why?
Grandma gave them two rectangular plots of the same size to paint as shown below. Find the fraction of the given plot i & plot ii and tell which plot has a larger shaded area.
Tom asked Maya to arrange the following fractions in descending order: 7/8, 7/25, 7/11, 7/18, 7/13
Grandma asked Maya and Tom to arrange the following fractions in descending order: 23/47, 23/29, 23/41, 23/31, 23/37

In the kitchen, Grandma had two plates of cookies. On one plate, 5/7 of the cookies were chocolate chips, and on the other plate, 5/12 of the cookies were chocolate chips. Which plate has a larger portion of chocolate chip cookies?
options: Both plates have the same portion

question: Maya and Tom found three jars of marbles. In the first jar, 2/5 of the marbles were blue, in the second jar, 3/5, and in the third jar, 4/5. Arrange the jars in descending order based on the portion of blue marbles.
options: First jar, second jar, third jar
Third jar, second jar, first jar
Third jar, first jar, second jar

question: Maya asked Tom to arrange the following fractions in ascending order: 5/3, 5/6, 5/9, 5/12, 5/18.

While sorting Grandma's button collection, Maya and Tom found that 7/5 of the buttons in one box were blue and 7/8 of the buttons in another box were blue. Which box has a larger portion of blue buttons?
options: Both boxes have the same portion

question: Grandma has a basket of apples. If Maya ate 1/4 of the apples, how many apples did Tom eat if he ate an equivalent fraction?

Maya and Tom found two jars of marbles in the attic. The first jar has 3/10 of its marbles painted red, and the second jar has 3/5 of its marbles painted red. Which jar has a larger portion of red marbles?
options: Both jars have the same portion
